Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, fabric is grey in section, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a highly burnished cream-coloured slip and with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text, identifying contents as shedeh-brew.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 74
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393186) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393186)
